ca.mcgill.hs.classifiers.location
Class Location

java.lang.Object
  ca.mcgill.hs.classifiers.location.Location
Direct Known Subclasses:
GPSLocation, WifiLocation
public abstract class Location
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a location, not necessarily physical, but characterized by a set of observations, and a means for computing distances based on these observations. Locations are stored in a database, tagged with a timestamp, and maintain a list of neighbours.

Constructor Detail

Location

public Location(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                double timestamp)
Creates a new location with the specified timestamp, and adds it to the database

Parameters:
db - The database in which these locations will be stored.
timestamp - The timestamp, in milliseconds since the epoch (similar to what is returned by System.currentTimeMillis()) associated with the location. Note that this timestamp is really only useful for debugging, and may change when points are merged.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

Location

public Location(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                int id)
Creates a location that is linked to a record in the database.

Parameters:
db - The database in which these locations will be stored.
id - The id of the new location.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

addObservation

public abstract void addObservation(Observation observation)
Adds an observation to this location. Typically these observations will be averaged out to form an average observation for the location.

observation -
